title: Business & Finance
text:
Earnings-season results so far have been lackluster, clouding the outlook for stocks, amid a rising-interest-rate environment and other challenges to business.

---

Wrangling in Congress over government funding for the semiconductor industry is leaving tens of billions of dollars of potential factory projects in limbo.

---

Fears of a global recession and deepening woes in Europe are pushing the dollar higher, and few on Wall Street expect to see a change in its trajectory soon.

---

Restaurants and grocery stores said they are revamping operations in response to crime, with some operators limiting hours, spending more on security and closing stores entirely.

---

Boeing 's commercial airplanes chief said the manufacturer was "very close" to resuming 787 Dreamliner deliveries after a nearly two-year pause.

---

Grubhub is hustling to catch up to rivals like DoorDash and Uber's Eats in online food ordering, a business it once led.

---

Tanker owners in Europe are shipping as much Russian crude as possible before energy sanctions against Moscow take effect in December.
